basic_info.name: Mahindra XUV400
basic_info.description: Mahindra XUV400 is a 5-seater electric SUV available at a starting price of Rs. 15.49 Lakh. The electric car is available in 5 variants.Additionally, XUV400 offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 200 mm and a Boot capacity of 378 liters. You can choose from 15 colors for the XUV400. The battery range/mileage of the XUV400 is 456 Km/Full Charge.

Introduction: The XUV400 is a ‘fun, fast, and eco-friendly’ electric compact SUV.
It features three driving modes and a quick acceleration from 0-100kmph in 8.3 seconds, making it versatile on road.
Furthermore, the compact SUV offers modern features such as dual-zone AC, and wireless charging.​
A few of its safety features include all four-disc brakes, TPMS, and a five-star Bharat NCAP rating.
The XUV400 blends style and modern features at a relatively accessible price point in the EV segment.​
Mahindra XUV400 – Exterior: Up front, a single plate grille is paired with projector headlamps and LED DRLs that extend into copper strips.
Then, a copper finished Mahindra twin peaks logo adds a classy touch.
On the side, its muscular fenders and character lines have been complemented by roof rails.
While the base model gets steel wheels, the top-spec models feature 16-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels.
Furthermore, these wheels are shod with 205/65 R16 sized tyres.
More functional exterior elements are electrically adjustable and foldable ORVMs with LED turn indicators.
At the back, there are large LED taillamps with intricate elements.
Moreover, the rear section includes a spoiler and copper-finished XUV400 and EV logos.
Additional exterior cues include an electric sunroof, rain-sensing wipers, auto headlamps, and satin copper inserts.
Mahindra XUV400 – Interior: Inside, the dual-toned interiors come in light-grey and black accents with satin-copper highlights.​
The cabin is best-in class with a 2,600mm wheelbase providing adequate space for five.
Even the rear legroom is good, and the SUV gets a 378-litre boot capacity.
Then, the SUV’s seats are upholstered in natural-grain perforated leatherette with copper stitching.​​
A 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital driver's display shows all important information.
Adding on, the Adrenox app integration offers 55+ connected car features.
Moreover, other features include wireless charging, USB ports, 60:40 split-folding rear seats, height-adjustable driver seat, rear armrest, and an electric sunroof.
Mahindra XUV400 – Powertrain: The XUV400 features a ‘Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor’ (PMSM).
This motor delivers 149.55bhp and 310Nm of torque mated to an automatic transmission.
Then, there are two battery options for the XUV400 - 39.4kWh and 34.5kWh.
The XUV400 offers an MIDC-claimed range of 456km on a single charge.
A standard 7.2kW AC charger takes six hours and thirty minutes for a full 0-100 per cent charge.
On the other hand, a 50kW DC fast charger achieves 0-80 per cent in 50 minutes.
